summary: This document is an email chain discussing an internal report (the 'Epstein Draft') related to overtime occurrences at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The correspondence involves Bureau of Prisons officials analyzing staffing and overtime data, specifically noting the temporary assignment of officers from other locations during a period when Jeffrey Epstein was detained there.

persons.name: Jeffery Keller
persons.role: Regional Director, Northeast Region, Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Appears to be the recipient of the 'Epstein Draft' report and is involved in the email discussion about overtime and staffing analysis at MCC New York.

persons.name: Ray Ormond
persons.context: Mentioned via a vCard attachment (.vcf file), suggesting he is a contact involved in the correspondence chain.

connections.description: Implied professional relationship within the Bureau of Prisons, as Ormond's contact info is shared in an email chain where Keller is a primary participant discussing an internal report.

events.title: Internal Review of MCC NY Overtime and Staffing
events.description: Email correspondence among Bureau of Prisons officials discussing an 'Epstein Draft' report that analyzes overtime occurrences at MCC New York, specifically questioning how the temporary assignment of 15 officers from other locations affected overtime data.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC NYM), New York
keyFacts: The document references an internal report titled 'Epstein Draft', analyzing overtime at the MCC in New York where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
During a 30-day period, approximately 15 officers from other locations were temporarily assigned (TDY) to MCC New York.
The email discussion centers on whether this temporary staffing should be noted to contextualize overtime data, suggesting concerns about staff shortages and fatigue.
The correspondence date (August 16, 2019) is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019, indicating post-incident internal review.
